alert.note: Alert for Crawford; Franklin; Madison; Washington (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 17 at 12:34AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Madison, northern Franklin, central Crawford and southeastern Washington Counties through 100 AM CDT... At 1234 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles east of Winslow to 2 miles east of Cedarville. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations in or near the path include... Cedarville... Mountainburg... Natural Dam... Alma... Mulberry... Dyer... Winslow... Chester... Rudy... Cass... Lake Fort Smith... Fern... Lee Creek... Jethro... Bidville... Piney... Locke... Turners Bend... Mount Gayler... This includes the following highways, Interstate 40 in Arkansas between mile markers 11 and 26. Interstate 49 between mile markers 22 and 40. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
